#### Speak to ALL Not everyone is going to read everything. People skim through content and if it doesn't interest them, they leave. So, write for all types of readers and keep everyone hooked. Successfully uploaded Update available The selected file is uploaded from your desktop Install Latest Version
#### Stay FOCUSED Don't get lost in your thoughts, remove the fluff and focus on what you want to say to your users. Phone number not available Patient not found No phone number is available for selected state. We could not find any profile that matches your patient.
#### Stick to AMERICANISM Driven by our customer base we need to stick to American English and make sure our products, user interface, website and product documentation are uniform everywhere. American English prefers to go with simpler sentence structure. For example: Brits go on holidays, while Americans go on vacation. American sayings:
"It's not rocket science." "Under the weather." "Break a leg." "Period."


#### Go BASIC Going basic doesn't mean you start sounding bland and dull. You can of course add a little wink to your content. Specific language Definite language Consistent language General language Vague language Random language
#### Stay with YOU Get more personal with your words. People love being spoken or written to. The word 'you' is both the subject and the object form. A single word like 'you' can refer to one or more than one person. You are all set to install the newest version. Update the way you take notes with the newest version of InNote. The new version is ready to be installed. Update the better version of InNote.
#### Get more ACTIVE Users struggle with passive voice. It sounds very verbose, ambiguous and odd. They understand you better, when you use the active form. You are reading this web page. Jane wrote the email. The web page is being read by you. The email was written by Jane.
#### Cut the CRAP You don't need what you don't need. No unnecessary words. No unnecessary sentences. Not that you make all the sentences short, avoid the detailing and treatment it needs. Write, to make every word tell. He Big picture Advanced He is a man who This is the big picture. The most advanced
#### Go GENDERLESS Sound genderless and address your users' in the right way. Use 'they', 'them', 'their' if the user's gender is unknown. They, them, their, unknown LGBTQA
#### Stay POSITIVE While writing always stick to being positive because nobody likes to hear negative things. Better connections mean better outcomes. Effectively engage and communicate with your patients.
